Description.content: An administrator has all rights inside the OU and consequently, has all other OU-specific roles. In particular, permissions on VFS resources are ignored for administrators, as they are VFS resource managers.

Description.name: Description0
Description.content: The account manager can manage users and groups. Account managers are automatically workplace users (and have all the roles implied by workplace users).

Description.name: Description0
Description.content: The Project Manager can manage projects. This role was important in older OpenCms versions, but in current versions there usually is no need to manually add, delete or manage projects. The role implies being a workplace user, and thus also the roles implied by workplace user.

Description.name: Description0
Description.content: The VFS resource manager can manage all resources in the OU, and hence can add, delete and alter all resources. Permission checks are ignored. For example, a resource manager may add and edit JSPs. Being a VFS resource manager involves having all the roles listed below.

Description.name: Description0
Description.content: Template developers can add and edit model pages. Note that, before OpenCms version 9.5, they could also add and edit JSPs. To allow such JSP manipulation, now the role VFS resource manager is required. Template developers automatically have all the roles listed below.

Description.name: Description0
Description.content: A workplace user can access the traditional workplace and thus browse the VFS via the explorer. This role cannot access the root site and has only very limited access to administrative tools. Workplace users automatically have all the roles listed below.

Description.name: Description0
Description.content: The category editor has access only to ADE views. This role can create, edit and delete categories via the sitemap editor and automatically has all the roles listed below, except that of Gallery Editor.

Description.name: Description0
Description.content: Gallery editors have only access to ADE views. They can create or delete (image, download, ...) galleries via the sitemap editor. They also have all the roles listed below.

Description.name: Description0
Description.content: An editor can create, delete and alter content on pages and change the sitemap. The role implies being an element author.

Description.name: Description0
Description.content: An element author can only access the page editor (and content editors). This role can create, add and edit content elements.
